jobDescription: TitleSystem Administrator (Journeyman)LocationNational Capital Region / Washington, D.C.Chameleon Integrated Services, a fast-growing certified Small Disadvantaged Business (SDB) and a graduate of the Small Business Administration 8(a) Business Development program, with a strong track record working within the DOD and Federal Government agencies, is looking for a high performing Stystem Administrator in the National Capital Region. The System Administrator (Journeyman) will focus on the implementation, deployment, and sustainment of leading-edge technologies that is revolutionizing federal IT infrastructure. This is an excellent opportunity for a System Administrator who is CCNA-certified and interested in further developing their career and actively pursuing advanced certifications such as CCNP and CCIE. A successful candidate will have a CCNA or equivalent; and CompTia Security +This opportunity will place you as the journeyman on software-defined networks and sustainment issues involving complex IT environments. You will support major programs and initiatives within the Department of Defense (DoD) and achieve centralized network control and significant improvement to critical network performance and monitoring. The position is part of a small, motivated team of architects, engineers, and developers who are focused on the design, development, and deployment of infrastructure, across the Enterprise ecosystem. As such, this position will require a professional who isknowledgeable in software architecture, software development and software integration. Duties include but are not limited to:-Maintains smooth operation of multi-user computer systems, including coordination with network engineers.-Monitors and manages system resources, including CPU usage, disk usage, and response times to maintain operating efficiency.-Performs systems security administration functions, including creating user profiles and accounts.-Other duties may include setting up administrator accounts, maintaining system documentation, tuning system performance, installing system wide software and allocating mass storage space.-Interacts with users and evaluates vendor products.-Makes recommendations to purchase hardware and software, coordinates installation and provides backup recovery.-Develops and monitors policies and standards for allocation related to the use of computing resources. May be assigned responsibility for less experienced staff.
